title: Netflix and Peacock video has stopped working (but I can still hear the audio). Same issue on Chrome and Safari.
content:
I decided to download Firefox and make it my default browser, so I downloaded it and followed some recommendations I found online for configuring security settings...but for the life of me I can't remember what those are.

Weeks later, I decide to watch Peacock, but the error message says I need to disable my ad blocker. I search for an ad blocker in the extensions but can't find one, so I start disabling other extensions like Facebook Container...but to now avail. I follow all the usual online steps--clearing my cache, restarting the application, restarting my computer, etc--but nothing works. I have the same error with Netflix, and switching to another browser yields the same result. So it must be something wrong with my system.

Can you help?

title: why can't I set up a favorites bar at the top of my screen so I can drag the url of the site I visit often to it?
content:
For several years I have had the favorites bar at the top of my monitor where I would drag a website I visit often. I just switched to another mac mini and every time I try to find help on establishing the favorites bar I always get "bookmarks tool bar". I don't want my book marks scattered across the upper screen so I hid that feature. Does the version of firefox I am using on this computer not provide that option?

Here is what Google says:

If you can't set up a website favorites bar (also called the bookmarks toolbar) on Firefox on your Mac Mini, it's likely because the "Bookmarks Toolbar" option is simply turned off in your Firefox settings; you need to go into the customization menu and explicitly enable it to make it visible again.

If you go to customization you have all kinds of options but I don't see anything about setting up a favorites bar (and I have no idea on how or where to drag those choices featured).

title: Informatica cloud (IICS) taskflow does not load only in Firefox
content:
I am using Informatica cloud(IICS) through Firefox and use MacOS. It worked absolutely fine when I was using it before 7-8 months earlier. Even the "Firefox 99.0.dmg" absolutely works fine but it feels laggy because it is older (this is not an issue). But when I download the latest Firefox from the Firefox site, it just keeps on loading the taskflow infinitely and taskflow does not get loaded.

Steps to replicate: 1. Create a account using https://dm-us.informaticacloud.com/identity-service/home 2. Create a new taskflow (steps) 3. It will keeps on loading.

However, when I use edge, chrome, brave, it works fine. Not sure what is blocking the taskflow to load. It hits the URL: https://usw5.dm-us.informaticacloud.com/diUI/products/integrationDesign/main/taskflow/__new_ae_florence_docentry_1

title: Address bar is justified right for no reason. This will probably be the last straw for me when it comes this crappy Firefox browser.
content:
Why... why on earth would the people who built Firefox include a mechanism (I will not call it a feature) that causes the address bar to justify to the right. It's confusing and annoying and remarkably challenging to fix from what I can tell. Several threads on various sites never did fix this issue.

So, come on Firefox brains - if you guys and gals are so smart and have such a good thing here, why can't you figure out how to get the text justified back to the left.

This just proves Firefox is the Kia of website browsers. More private? Maybe, but because it's more antiquated and amateurishly designed.

Solutions? I won't hold my breath. I'm on Windows 10 Home.
